column4: hey, whenever I modify a file, another hidden file is created with the same name and "~" suffix - what is that?
actually its a backup of that file
I need space on the hard drive; how will I be able to use that backup anyway?
I modified .bashrc, the original takes 3 KB, the backup takes also 3 KB
but anyways, i dont think i know and dont think this is a good idea at all
what are you trying to do?
yes, but the same happens for every other file, so it takes twice as much space as it should
I want to understand why it's working like that and how can I profit from it or disable that behavior
its not for all files, mostlyfor system files or applications which implement that behaviour
for example a config file in a game might auto create a backup
all such backup fils combined wont cross 100 kb onyour system
